body_text:
Attempting to edit 'inline' styles via the Firefox devtools results in a CSP error and the styles not applying to the DOM element.
Steps to reproduce:

Open devtools, use element inspector to select any element
Add styles to the element's inline section.
Notice a Content Security Policy in console as you enter styles:

Content Security Policy: The page’s settings blocked the loading of a resource at self (“default-src https://localhost:8000”). Source: color: #000;.

Here, color: #000; was the attempted styling - you'll notice the CSP error throws as you type out the style. No styles are applied to the page.
Interestingly, editing styles within existing selectors/classes is fine - no CSP errors, applies to the page correctly. I think the devtools are attempting to append a <style> tag to the page and the CSP settings aren't cool with that - but that's a total guess.

title: CSP prevents inline style editing
body:
Attempting to edit 'inline' styles via the Firefox devtools results in a CSP error and the styles not applying to the DOM element.

Steps to reproduce:

- Open devtools, use element inspector to select any element
- Add styles to the [element's inline section](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2767162/24156784/29b6f6e2-0e1d-11e7-8fc9-1d2ffb5f6deb.png).
- Notice a `Content Security Policy` in console as you enter styles:

```
Content Security Policy: The page’s settings blocked the loading of a resource at self (“default-src https://localhost:8000”). Source: color: #000;.
```

Here, `color: #000;` was the attempted styling - you'll notice the CSP error throws as you type out the style. No styles are applied to the page.

Interestingly, editing styles within existing selectors/classes is fine - no CSP errors, applies to the page correctly. I think the devtools are attempting to append a `<style>` tag to the page and the CSP settings aren't cool with that - but that's a total guess.
